p: Houston was 1 of 6 cities awarded funds from the Centers of Disease Control and Prevention for HIV prevention, including health education, counseling and testing, public information and minority campaigns, plus support for community-based organizations (CBOs). The Ryan White Comprehensive AIDS Resources Emergency Act was enacted in 1990 to provide federal funds for HIV care [ 32]. Given the epidemic’s severity, under the program’s first year, Harris and 5 surrounding counties received $3.7 million in 1991, followed by continued substantial funding, which revolutionized HIV care in Houston and nationwide.
